paragraphs.text: Lebanon has just done the unthinkable.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Lebanon has just done the apparently unthinkable and placed visa control on the entry of Syrians into the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Before, the situation was effectively a free flow that had resulted in Syrians, mostly refugees, amounting today to 20 percent of the population on Lebanese soil
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Imagine 12 million French in the UK today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Lebanese government has assured international agencies that it will still permit and facilitate humanitarian cases
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the step is a telling one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The real story behind this is the annihilation of borders from Baghdad to Beirut
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ISIL is one stark and ugly manifestation of that reality but so are the refugees, a tragic event that has also affected Turkey and Jordan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This zone that once facilitated trade is now closer to scenes from Road Warrior - or the sad march of the displaced
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The disintegration of Sykes Picot has blurred nation-states
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: cross border allegiances fight it out on a series of fronts and through a myriad of forces from Jubhat al-Nusra, Shia militias, Peshmergas, to the Lebanese Armed forces to the now infamous ISIL
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Borders don't seem to mean much in this Middle East
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they ever did
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The refugees are the terrible consequence and victims of these conflicts that plague this area
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: The best response to them is not visas but a proper joint response by the Lebanese government assisted by international insititutions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The reality however is that the former is incapable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the latter insufficiently funded to deal with such a massive influx
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As a result, many refugees are living in terrible conditions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The other harsh reality is that the Lebanese government has said that this will not affect Syrian "visitors" to Lebanon
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There are six classes of visitors in the new system
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Syrian middle class and rich are unlikley to be affected
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Walid Jumblatt stated that his country should differentiate between "refugees who are fleeing death and destruction in Syria after they lost their homes," and those who intend to be politically active
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the reality is that the poorest will be most affected
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Indeed
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's a large question mark whether Lebanon has the capacity to even implement the measure it has just taken
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Syrian presence in Lebanon is so pervasive it may well be impossible to manage the situation, except to manage some future inflow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Furthermore
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the idea of Lebanon, a country barely treading water, being able to manage such a problem is unrealistic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Only a regional and international effort of significance can manage such a scale
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: regional powers are busy carving their fiefdoms and creating the very problem rather than solving it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The plight of the refugees is key
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is also important to perceive this event from the perspective of the host country; a small nation with very poor governance and infrastructure in the midst of regional turmoil
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In a way, this is Lebanon's very small response to the erosion of Sykes Picot
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Syrians are indeed everywhere in Lebanon
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In Beirut, and in every village and town one visits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Flights from Beirut to Europe are one-third to half full of Syrians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Indeed
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: given this massive presence and Lebanon's already poor infrastructure and socio-economic state, it is an achievement that the Syrian crisis has not led to further deterioration in the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The relations in Lebanon between the two peoples, despite some racism and ugly incidents, could have been far worse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Until now, Lebanese hosting of the refugees is characterised by neither generosity nor enmity, but by a passive acceptance of fate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is partially driven by the fact that Syrians are culturally and linguistically akin
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: some sectors of the Lebanese economy, e.g  construction, remain highly dependent on Syrian workers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: How this will square with the new visa rules is unknown
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: More importantly, this step can be seen as part of a series of recent indirect actions that attempt to strengthen the Lebanese state, or at least make the pretense of doing so
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Minister of Health Abu Faour has been on an intense and mediatic campaign to clean up the food industry in Lebanon, cracking down restaurants, slaughterhouses, and airport storage sites
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Despite complaints, this clean up, if it lasts, is a welcome step for Lebanese
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is national, potentially affects everyone positively, and is an act of government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Second
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in an echo of the Nahr el-Bared campaign, the Lebanese army is taking responsibility in the Northern Bekaa and Hermel areas against the radical groups
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who are effectively fighting the Syrian war on Lebanese soil
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Pride in the Lebanese army is rising
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There are also rumours that the Lebanese government will also take on the murderous Indie-500 speeders on Lebanse highways in the spring
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this does occur in addition to bold step of visas for Syrians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: a move that would have been unheard of when Lebanon was effectively a vassal state of Damascus, then indeed Lebanon could see the bare beginnings of emerging out of chaos through these small attempts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The political realities in Lebanon are of course more complicated and illusory than this
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many only see in all of the above feeble attempts to deflect from the reality of a total political vaccuum
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Indeed
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Lebanese visa step is obviously not humanitarian
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is a self- interested attempt to stem the tide, put a thumb in the dyke, and avoid the emergent chaos in the Middle East
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It would be better if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Lebanese had the magnamity, or much more importantly, the capacity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: to continue simply receiving all Syrians
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are barely running their own country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Compassion requires an orderly method and capacities in order to be effectively pursued
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: i.e
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Lebanese need a functioning state of their own to handle such a crisis properly
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Indeed
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Lebanon has mostly escaped the wars next door not out of wisdom or discipline, or any energetic international diplomacy, but because the memories of that conflict are still vivid in the minds of Lebanese adults
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No one will go to war
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because they remember what war costs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: because they know how little they derived from the devastation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The result of 15 years of fighting was that the state was further weakened in favour of sectarianism, cronyism and corruption
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while the Lebanese kept on doing what they do best, make money and enjoy life, living for today and certainly not tomorrow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Meanwhile, social and environmental erosion make the country less and less livable by the day
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The recent steps however, triggered by political challenges and health risks, signal some early and feeble attempts at a return of the state, or at the very least preserving the semblance of the old order, the shadow of a nation-state, amidst the dark fluidity and chaos surging from there to Kurdistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It took the Lebanese 40 years and external pressures to begin to think about getting their house in order
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that is indeed what is happening today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Hopefully, it won't take their neighbours that long to start to address the necessary basics of life
paragraphs.label: assumption
